Items.title: Request to add svc_pr_vsmind to svc_pr_cdmp headless account

comments.comment_body: User svc_pr_vsmind has been added to svc_pr_cdmp by @Hao Fu

Added group admin(s) as watchers for approval. This request requires one of the following people to approve it in self service: @Naren Bhosle @Anupchandra Rao @Hao Fu @Chris Trezzo Please log in and visit https://www.grid.linkedin.com/self_service/#/account/svc_pr_cdmp to review this request.

content.issue_title: Request to add svc_pr_vsmind to svc_pr_cdmp headless account
content.issue_description: Glean profile  has requested to add the  svc_pr_vsmind          headless account to the  svc_pr_cdmp  headless account. This would allow  svc_pr_vsmind : Access to all files on HDFS owned by  svc_pr_cdmp Permission to create and delete files on HDFS owned by  svc_pr_cdmp

slack thread: Main thread: The absence of misc under /export/apps/gridops/ causing failure in corepam module convergence The dir is being created by the gridhadoop module and not in corepam since these hosts were k8s hosts and the gridhadoop module wonâ€™t be converged here (Since the gridhadoop is ramped by grid hosts only for hadoop worker fleet) We should revisit the approach creating misc dir under /export/apps/gridops fixes the issue with ownership root:hadooop and perm 755

content.issue_title: grid hosts faling ucm due to corepam module
content.issue_description:
We have received ucm failures on over 150 grid hosts due to the  corepam  module, with the error below.  sample hosts : ltx1-hcl31934.grid.linkedin.com ltx1-hcl29075.grid.linkedin.com puppet apply log for  corepam root@ltx1-hcl31934 [ ~ ]# /opt/puppetlabs/bin/puppet apply -e  'include corepam'
Notice: Scope(Class[Corepam::Smart_quota]): running corepam smartquota
Error: Could not find resource 'File[/export/apps/gridops]' in parameter 'require' (file: /export/content/ucm/puppet/modules/corepam/manifests/smart_quota.pp, line: 49) on node ltx1-hcl31934.grid.linkedin.com
root@ltx1-hcl31934 [ ~ ]#  log: Error: Could not set 'file' on ensure: No such file or directory - A directory component in /export/apps/gridops/misc/smart_quota.profile20250721-908314-139stjo.lock does not exist or is a dangling symbolic link (file: /export/content/ucm/puppet/modules/corepam/manifests/smart_quota.pp, line: 56)
Error: Could not set 'file' on ensure: No such file or directory - A directory component in /export/apps/gridops/misc/smart_quota.profile20250721-908314-139stjo.lock does not exist or is a dangling symbolic link (file: /export/content/ucm/puppet/modules/corepam/manifests/smart_quota.pp, line: 56)
Wrapped exception:
No such file or directory - A directory component in /export/apps/gridops/misc/smart_quota.profile20250721-908314-139stjo.lock does not exist or is a dangling symbolic link
Error: /Stage[main]/Corepam::Smart_quota/File[/export/apps/gridops/misc/smart_quota.profile]/ensure: change from 'absent' to 'file' failed: Could not set 'file' on ensure: No such file or directory - A directory component in /export/apps/gridops/misc/smart_quota.profile20250721-908314-139stjo.lock does not exist or is a dangling symbolic link (file: tags.name: Infra_DNS_Failure
tags.description: DNS resolution errors impacting system access or routing

Items.title: Investigate why AAAA record for lva2-hcl7897.grid.linkedin.com was deleted

comments.comment_body: Confirmed with the dnsdb team. Following are the rules and the above seems to be an accidental manual deletion: The rules are as below If the host has grid in the hostnanme if skip-aaaa-record was specified for a non grid host For all other hosts IPv6  is configured in Linux  and AAAA record + reverse are added We shall have to manually create a AAAA dns record for every grid host. Slack thread here:

Checking the audit log again https://observe.prod.linkedin.com/g/d/logchain-app-dnsdb/dnsdb?orgId=1&var-resource_key=&var-resource_type=Record&var-resource_attribute=All&var-last_modified_actor=All&var-resource_value=2a04:f547:b3:161::5863&from=now%2Fy&to=now

content.issue_title: Investigate why AAAA record for lva2-hcl7897.grid.linkedin.com was deleted
content.issue_description: Action Item for  https://rootly.com/account/incidents/6215  : One of the RCs for incident 6215 was the deletion of the AAAA record for lva2-hcl7897.grid.linkedin.com (== lva1-pokemonnn02-ha2.grid.linkedin.com). The record was added when the host was imaged as a replacement for the corresponding NN in lva1. However, sometime afterwards, the AAAA record was deleted. As we're adopting IPv6 for HDFS and other grid services, it's important to understand why the AAAA record was deleted so we can prevent this from happening in the future. Slack thread  discussing this issue during the incident DNSDB logs Screenshot for posterity, in case the logs are deleted:

Items.title: Grid - Change Directory Owner and/or Permissions in HDFS - 2025-07-21

comments.comment_body: Not sure how you would do it in airflow. You might want to reach out to azkaban/airflow team but it would essentially be the same command you ran on the gateway hadoop fs -setfacl -R -m user:metrics:r-x /jobs/hssotmetrics/u_hssotmetrics.db// but on the path you create or just created. I believe in airflow they have a hadoopJavaOperator which you might be able to leverage. but unsure if it uses java packages or cli
this is the limitation of setfacl TL;DR for every new folder generation your job should set the facl
Thanks @Heagan Ahmed can we have some examples on how to set the facl on our upstream airflow?

content.issue_title: Grid - Change Directory Owner and/or Permissions in HDFS - 2025-07-21
content.issue_description:
HDFS Path: /jobs/hssotmetrics/u_hssotmetrics.db Error Message: Permission denied: user=metrics, access=READ, inode="/jobs/hssotmetrics/u_hssotmetrics.db/talent_agent_sourcing_user_operation_base_table/datepartition=2025-07-18-00/20250720_075123_16373_we7ep_d6f6e365-7c7e-419f-b281-88e66183611e":hssotmetrics:hssotmetrics: rw-r ---- Cluster Name: holdem HDFS User or Headless Account Name that launches the Job: hssotmetrics Nested Titles: Grid / Change Directory Owner and/or Permissions in HDFS Hi team  @heahmed ! We are having permissions issue for ump flow  hp_reporting_usage Permission denied: user=metrics, access=READ, inode="/jobs/hssotmetrics/u_hssotmetrics.db/talent_agent_sourcing_user_operation_base_table/datepartition=2025-07-18-00/20250720_075123_16373_we7ep_d6f6e365-7c7e-419f-b281-88e66183611e":hssotmetrics:hssotmetrics:-rw-r----- However, even tho we set the permissions by running  hadoop fs -setfacl -R -m user:metrics:r-x  and the backfill succeeded ( execution link ) after then, the flow still failed on the second day. Looks like the permission got reset after the  upstream flow  finishes or we need to grant the permission in a different folder. Can we get some help here? Below are the commands I ran to grant permissions ssh -K ltx1-holdemgw01.grid.linkedin.com
ksudo -e hssotmetrics
hadoop fs -setfacl -R -m user:metrics:r-x /jobs/hssotmetrics/u_hssotmetrics.db/applicants_actions_main_table
hadoop fs -setfacl -R -m user:metrics:r-x /jobs/hssotmetrics/u_hssotmetrics.db/applicants_evaluation_table
hadoop fs -setfacl -R -m user:metrics:r-x /jobs/hssotmetrics/u_hssotmetrics.db/talent_agent_sourcing_main_aggregate_info
hadoop fs -setfacl -R -m user:metrics:r-x /jobs/hssotmetrics/u_hssotmetrics.db/talent_agent_user_usage_base_v2
hadoop fs -setfacl -R -m user:metrics:r-x /jobs/hssotmetrics/u_hssotmetrics.db/talent_agent_sourcing_user_operation_base_table

GroupMetaData.Actions: JIRA workflow improvements: [1] Process optimization recommendations: Develop and implement automation to address 'Automation_Missing' gaps, potentially reducing manual intervention times. [2] Workflow configuration changes: Introduce SLA tracking for high-priority issues to ensure timely resolution and avoid extended investigation periods. [3] Team coordination enhancements: Encourage better collaboration and detailed comment history to improve knowledge sharing and root cause discovery. [4] Issue prevention strategies: Conduct a postmortem on extended investigations (e.g., 339-hour resolution) to identify preventable root causes such as 'Infra_DNS_Failure' and implement proactive monitoring or preemptive checks.
GroupMetaData.Insight: JIRA process intelligence: [1] Issue triage and assignment effectiveness: All issues were categorized and assigned within business hours on the day they were created, highlighting acceptable triage timeliness. [2] Workflow transition patterns and bottlenecks: Resolution times varied significantly, with one issue resolved in 53 hours while another remains open and one took over 339 hours, indicating resolution inefficiencies, particularly for high-priority or complex cases. [3] Team collaboration and handoff quality: Minimal communication was observed per issue (2-3 comments), which may suggest either streamlined processes or insufficient discussion. Assigned owners persisted throughout, implying stable ownership. [4] Recurring issue themes and root causes: Common tags like 'Automation_Missing' hint at recurring gaps in automation and potentially avoidable toil. [5] Resolution time distribution and efficiency patterns: The wide resolution time disparity reflects opportunities to standardize and expedite workflows, especially handling high-severity issues.
GroupMetaData.Summary: JIRA workflow summary: Overall issue management efficiency, team coordination patterns, and workflow bottlenecks for this issue group

GroupMetaData.Actions: JIRA workflow improvements: [1] Process optimization recommendations include implementing automated tagging and prioritization for 'Automation_Missing' issues to ensure faster triage. [2] Workflow configuration changes should address inefficiencies in the status transition process by enforcing detailed transition requirements and progress updates. [3] Team coordination enhancements could focus on handoff documentation standards, ensuring smooth transitions during rotation. [4] Issue prevention strategies should involve root cause analysis and remedial training or improvements to configuration processes to reduce recurring Config_Error issues.
GroupMetaData.Insight: JIRA process intelligence: [1] Issue triage and assignment effectiveness is moderate, with prompt assignment but no clear priority labeling for efficient handling. [2] Workflow transition patterns reveal limited status changes (only 2 transitions per issue) and extended resolution time for GRID-287111. [3] Team collaboration and handoff quality indicate a need for improved documentation, especially for APA-131504 which remains open and may affect handoffs. [4] Recurring issue themes include configuration errors across both issues, indicating systemic challenges with configuration processes. [5] Resolution time distribution highlights inefficiency, especially with GRID-287111 requiring over 53 hours for resolution.
GroupMetaData.Summary: JIRA workflow summary: Overall issue management efficiency is moderate, with minimal communication overhead but some inefficiencies in resolution time and status transitions. Team coordination patterns include clear assignee roles but require improvements in handoff preparedness. Workflow bottlenecks are observed in extended resolution times and minimal status transition activity.

GroupMetaData.Actions: JIRA workflow improvements: [1] Streamline triage processes with automation [2] Implement deduplication mechanisms for similar tickets [3] Introduce Priority fields to clarify issue urgency [4] Expand team collaboration and documentation standards [5] Address systemic causes of recurring quota and infra-related issues through project enhancements.
GroupMetaData.Insight: JIRA process intelligence: [1] Issue triage and assignment effectiveness [2] Workflow transition patterns and bottlenecks [3] Team collaboration and handoff quality [4] Recurring issue themes and root causes [5] Resolution time distribution and efficiency patterns
GroupMetaData.Summary: JIRA workflow summary: Overall issue management efficiency, team coordination patterns, and workflow bottlenecks for this issue group

GroupMetaData.Actions: JIRA workflow improvements: [1] Process optimization recommendations: Introduce stricter SLAs for resolution and triage, especially for 'Unspecified' priority issues. [2] Workflow configuration changes: Automate tagging and prioritization for recurring tags like 'Quota_Request' to streamline ticket triage. [3] Team coordination enhancements: Provide pre-handoff summary or knowledge transfer for off-hours issues to reduce delays in off-call handling. [4] Issue prevention strategies: Perform root cause analysis for 'Quota_Request' to prevent repetitive access-related issues. Focus on identifying high-frequency queries and automating their resolution.
GroupMetaData.Insight: JIRA process intelligence: [1] Issue triage and assignment effectiveness: All issues were categorized and assigned within the same day they were created, but there are inefficiencies in prioritization (e.g., 'Unspecified' priorities create ambiguity). [2] Workflow transition patterns and bottlenecks: Open statuses lingering without transitions suggest delays in resolution momentum, especially for Issues 1 and 2. [3] Team collaboration and handoff quality: Medium complexity and off-hours creation for Issues 1 and 2 may indicate poor handoff preparation for oncall teams. [4] Recurring issue themes and root causes: Recurring 'Quota_Request' tags highlight recurring access management challenges. Similar topics across Issues 1 and 2 may represent duplicated efforts. [5] Resolution time distribution and efficiency patterns: While Issue 3 was resolved within 5 hours, extended investigation hints at inefficient escalations or unclear ownership, which may increase toil.
GroupMetaData.Summary: JIRA workflow summary: Overall issue management efficiency, team coordination patterns, and workflow bottlenecks for this issue group

content.issue_title: Requesting the node for Trino's NSS migration in prod-lva1
content.issue_description: Hello Grid Team,  Trino team is planning prod-lva1 migration. However, We do not have spare machines to perform this migration thus requesting machines for it.  NSS Details: Trino cluster: war01 product-tag:  war01-coordinator nss-pool:   prod-lva1.k8s-34.trino-4fce9 count:  2 product-tag:  war01-worker nss-pool:  prod-lva1.k8s-35.trino-4fce9 count:  9 Trino cluster: war02 product-tag:  war02-coordinator nss-pool:  prod-lva1.k8s-1.trino-4fce9 count:  2 product-tag:  war02-worker nss-pool:  prod-lva1.k8s-36.trino-4fce9 count:  9 Additional 4 machines for the trino-war-preprod canary.

content.issue_title: Promote headless account riioffline to war
content.issue_description: We started running one of our offline flows in war yesterday and it failed with the reason that ksudo is not able to impersonate as the headless account. Going through the slack threads, it seems like the headless account needs to be promoted to war. Following  this  wiki, below are the relevant required details. Successful holdem job link:  https://holdem.oklahoma-airflow.grid.linkedin.com/dags/OfflineFlowReporting_holdem5__talent-intelligence-hadoop/grid Iris plan link: rii_offline_oklahoma_low_priority War dag code link:  https://jarvis.corp.linkedin.com/codesearch/result/?name=OfflineFlowReporting_war__talent-intelligence-hadoop.py&path=talent-intelligence-hadoop%2Ftalent_intelligence_hadoop_airflow%2Fsrc%2Ftalent_intelligence_hadoop%2Ftalent_intelligence_hadoop_airflow%2Fwar&reponame=linkedin-multiproduct%2Ftalent-intelligence-hadoop Failed War Job Link: https://war.oklahoma-airflow.grid.linkedin.com/dags/OfflineFlowReporting_war__talent-intelligence-hadoop/grid?dag_run_id=scheduled__2025-07-22T23%3A00%3A00%2B00%3A00&task_id=create_offline_flow_report&map_index=-1&tab=logs Cluster name: war Error Message: Caused by: com.linkedin.ksudo.client.KSudoAuthenticationException: Ksudo authenticate  to service [lva2-atlas|HCAT, lva1-war|HCAT, lva2-atlas|JH, lva2-atlas|RM, lva2-atlas|HDFS, lva2-atlas|OPENHOUSE, lva1-war|HDFS]failed for user: riioffline, exception: Client-side error com.linkedin.restli.client.RestLiResponseException: Response status 403, serviceErrorMessage: Failed to fetch credential for located services lva2-atlas|HCAT: java.io.IOException: MetaException(message:org.apache.hadoop.security.authorize.AuthorizationException: User: ksudo@GRID.LINKEDIN.COM is not allowed to impersonate riioffline/mu_grid2_spark_6bff6292-6556-4ad1-af72-5257e0f1181e@GRID.LINKEDIN.COM) encountered Nested Titles: Grid / Other Grid Issue
